alert.note: Alert for Lee; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Lee and Owsley. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beattyville, Booneville, Levi, Pebworth, Scoville, Vincent, Turin, Ida May, Lower Buffalo, Endee, Delvinta, Corgleton, Travellers Rest, White Ash, Chestnut Gap, Caryton, Enoch, Belle Point, Major and Cressmont.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
